pull.title: Fix issues in ZMQ error handling
pull.body: Behaves better if abnormal issues occur

events.message:
Bugfix: ZMQ: Leave notifiers intact rather than shut them down if they fail a notification once

Whatever the cause of the failure, it makes more sense to keep trying rather than kill the notifier entirely
Bugfix: ZMQ: Don't try to use zmq_strerror when reading block from disk fails
ZMQ: If reading block from disk fails, log the block hash

issue.title: rpc,rest,zmq: faster getblock, NotifyBlock and rest_block by reading raw block
issue.body:
For the `getblock` endpoint with `verbosity=0`, the  `rest_block` REST endpoint for `bin` and `hex`, and zmq `NotifyBlock` we don't have to deserialize the block since we're just sending the raw data. This PR uses `ReadRawBlockFromDisk` instead of `ReadBlockFromDisk` to serve these requests, and only deserializes for `verbosity > 0` and `json` REST requests. See benchmarks in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26684.

Benchmarked using ApacheBench. Requesting block 750,000 in binary 10k times on a single core (set `-rest=1` in config):
`ab -n 10000 -c 1 "http://127.0.0.1:8332/rest/block/0000000000000000000592a974b1b9f087cb77628bb4a097d5c2c11b3476a58e.bin"`

On master, mean time 15ms.
On this branch, mean time 1ms.

For RPC
```
echo '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id": "curltest", "method": "getblock", "params": ["0000000000000000000592a974b1b9f087cb77628bb4a097d5c2c11b3476a58e", 0]}' > /tmp/data.json
ab -p /tmp/data.json -n 1000 -c 1 -A user:password "http://127.0.0.1:8332/"
```
On master, mean time 32ms
On this branch, mean time 13ms

events.body:
<!--2e250dc3d92b2c9115b66051148d6e47-->
ðŸ¤” There hasn't been much activity lately and the CI seems to be failing.

If no one reviewed the current pull request by commit hash, a [rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes) can be considered. While the CI failure may be a false positive, the CI hasn't been running for some time, so there may be a real issue hiding as well. A rebase triggers the latest CI and makes sure that no silent merge conflicts have snuck in.

The PR didn't seem to attract much attention in the past. Also, the issue seems not important enough right now to keep it sitting around idle in the list of open PRs.

Closing due to lack of interest.
